params.batch: Batch number - there is a limit of 10 validators per batch that delegator can claim rewards from in single tranaction

returns.end: Flag if there are no more validators left that delegator can claim rewards from*

params.batch: Batch number to be fetched. If the list is too big it cannot return all delegations in one call. Instead, users are fetching batches of 50 delegations at a time

returns.end: Flag if there are no more delegations left. To get all delegations, caller should fetch all batches until he sees end == true*

params.batch: Batch number to be fetched. If the list is too big it cannot return all undelegations in one call. Instead, users are fetching batches of 50 undelegations at a time

returns.end: Flag if there are no more undelegations left. To get all undelegations, caller should fetch all batches until he sees end == true*

params.batch: Batch number to be fetched. If the list is too big it cannot return all validators in one call. Instead, users are fetching batches of 100 account at a time

returns.end: Flag if there are no more accounts left. To get all accounts, caller should fetch all batches until he sees end == true*
returns.validators: Batch of N validators basic info

params.description: New description (e.g name, short purpose description, etc...)
params.endpoint: New endpoint, might be a validator's website*

claimAllRewards(uint32).notice: Claims staking rewards from all validators (limited by batch) that caller has delegated to

getDelegations(address,uint32).notice: Returns list of delegations for specified delegator - which validators delegator delegated to

getUndelegations(address,uint32).notice: Returns list of undelegations for specified delegator

getValidatorsFor(address,uint32).notice: Returns list of validators owned by an address

setValidatorInfo(address,string,string).notice: Sets some of the static validator details.
